A judge sentenced Lopez, 29, who admitted that after physically and emotionally abusing the child for months, she hit Elisa in the head and knocked her against a concrete wall last Nov. 20., to 15 years to life in prison. data.text:
Awilda Lopez, mother of slain Elisa Izquierdo, wipes a tear during sentencing for the murder of her daughter at State Supreme Court in New York Wednesday, July 31, 1996. A judge sentenced Lopez, 29, who admitted that after physically and emotionally abusing the child for months, she hit Elisa in the head and knocked her against a concrete wall last Nov. 20., to 15 years to life in prison. (AP Photo/Pool, Helayne Seidman)

Captions are provided by our contributors.
